website_summaries.verdict: Incredibly precise cooking process, and thanks to the magnetic base and clip, it can fit on any pot.
pros: You use your smartphone to to control the machine
and you don't have to sacrifice any counter space to store it
cons: You can only operate it with a smartphone or tablet

website_summaries.verdict: The Joule immersion circulator is the right product for the ambitious chef who's also into smart-home technology.
pros: The Wi-Fi-enabled $200 Joule immersion circulator has an app that will teach you a thing or two about sous vide cooking
The Joule also works with Alexa, Amazon's digital assistant, to help connect your cooking to the rest of your smart home
cons: The lack of controls on the body of the Joule could be irritating if you want to just glance at the immersion circulator to get an update on its status
The integration with Alexa still has some kinks to work out

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a while, then wouldn't stay connected to bluetooth and then started having issues maintaining temperature. Called Chef Steps directly and because I bought it from Amazon they cant help me and because Amazon return period has passed, I guess we are SOL.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: While it does start and cook food great, it always looses the internet connection
customer_reviews.text: While it does start and cook food great, it always looses the internet connection. As a result it never turns off when it should. So the timer feature is useless. This has been with four different phones and tablets, two different wifi connections, even tried using my mobile devices as mobile hot spots.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cerelli

customer_reviews.title: This thing is Awsome!
customer_reviews.text: I have been Sous Vide cooking for a while using a Paragon. While it worked just as well as this one it required a lot of space to store. This new Joule is smaller than I imagined and it really gets the water to temp quick. I purchased the LIPAVI container and tailored lid...they fit like a glove! I like Sous Vide since it only takes 5 minutes to set up and 5 minutes to clean up everything when done...does not disrupt my workflow and I eat better...win win! Just dropped in a Flat Iron steak...mouth watering already. Update: Just purchased a second one so I can do steaks at two different temps...these things ROCK!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Guy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is nonsense. If you do not leave your phone ten feetvaway, it stops working. Buy one with a real dial and quit trying to be high tech. It friggin is supposed to cook meat.
customer_reviews.author: Krista R. Graham

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes for this and was looking forward ...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this and was looking forward to trying it out. I ignored the Bluetooth connectivity issues reported in a few reviews and perhaps I received one of the dead units since I bought from amazon warehouse. I haven’t had any issues with amazon warehouse items in the past. I’m returning this model and will buy a new one. If it works out, I’ll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: So Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I read reviews and in the beginning the product was great. I had it for4 months and because it’s 4 months old I can’t return it. Or simply will not circulate, won’t cook well and I will have to buy another brand,so dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Lina Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the internet of things that don't work
customer_reviews.text: Brand new Christmas gift. The first thing it does out of the box is fail to connect to WiFi. The second thing it does is fail to perform a firmware update. The third thing it will do is get back into its box and head back to amazon. I have no room in my life for a device that is 100% dependent on a wireless connection that isn't reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the amount of errors
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through 2 of these Joule Sous Vide cookers. The first one lasted about 60 days and gave me a low water error. I was able to get a new one from warranty, and the knew one isnt even 25 days old and it has given me the same water level low error. If you look online there are tons of problems and reviews about this error. Outside of this breaking to often, it is absolutely the best sous vide on the market. However, planning to cook steaks and getting an error right before you immerse them is disappointing and frustrating. I will try another product just because these are not reliable and break WAY TO OFTEN.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Flawed. Seriously flawed. there is no back-up when it doesn't connect.
customer_reviews.text: WHEN this thing works, it works fine. Problem is, it can ONLY be used with an app on your cell phone. It is a highly flawed app. Most of the time it won't connect to the Joule via bluetooth. There is no back system. You can get a person to answer your question (IN TWO DAYS!!??) So if you need to cook something, say TODAY you are seriously out of luck. Update: After trying the "chat" I get directed to a page that doesn't open. It seems to be the we'll get back to you in two days page. So the prospect of ever solving the problem is zero. I'm returning this piece of cr@p.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Pitcock

customer_reviews.title: All the great features but one
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's been great! It's faster, quieter, and less finicky than my previous Anova One, which lost its ability to heat after 4 years of pretty diligent work. I like the connectivity of Joule. The other day I used Facebook messenger to preheat Joule from the store. It was ready to go in the short time it took me to get home. The single drawback, as far as I am concerned, IS the lack of interface on Joule itself. On that off chance that your smart device has failed and your bluetoothless computer can't access Facebook......you're screwed. If it's worth the risk (and it usually is), Joule is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E. Rhyner

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 5 minutes then died
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to use this product and found a good deal through Amazon Warehouse. Turned out to be a bad deal because I spent $160+ for about 5 minutes of use. I work in technology so wasn't concerned about trying the multiple options that ChefStep provided to reconnect (their website is very good BTW). Except none worked and I could not get the device to pair. Without that, you cannot use this device. And, since more than 30 days have elapsed since I purchased the item I cannot return it. Do yourself a favor, don't buy from Amazon Warehouse, it isn't worth the gamble.
customer_reviews.author: tigger-mojo

customer_reviews.title: This is "the one!"
customer_reviews.text: Did quite a bit of research regarding Sous Vide devices and was nervous purchasing any one of them - but I got a real winner with the Joule! The software app is a snap to work with and the unit has really delivered! So far I've cooked steak, chicken, pork and salmon with the Joule and everything has come out better than ever! Cooking salmon with the Joule is just the BEST - you'll never overcook fish again! We have been using the unit two to three times a week and look forward to expanding our cooking experience.
customer_reviews.author: CoastalRick

customer_reviews.title: System fail after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Solid yellow LED for system failure after 2 uses. Tried all fixes on vendor site (basically unplug Joule and try again, maybe it's your phone). Waiting to hear back from vendor support. Android app file and updates are large. Kicking myself for buying a product without basic onboard controls with well reviewed options (ANOVA) out there.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lenhart

customer_reviews.title: Another useless connected device
customer_reviews.text: I should have read more reviews before I purchased something based solely on ATK's recommendation. This device cannot be operated without a smartphone. I fail to see where all this connectivity is necessary in a simple kitchen appliance. I could understand if some monitoring features were optional based on smartphone connectivity. The bottom line is that you cannot even turn this device on without a smartphone and online account. I have enough online accounts. Epic fail, Joule.
customer_reviews.author: K. Currier

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor buy one that doesn't connect to ...
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor buy one that doesn't connect to the internet. App updates have left me unable to connect to the thing by my phone which is necessary to control the thing. Other than knowing if you've had a power outage I really can't see a benefit to connecting with the internet anyway.
customer_reviews.author: barrywood7

customer_reviews.title: Complex cooking tasks made super simple.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little gadget for the kitchen. Steaks and seafood come out perfectly cooked every single time. I wish that they would implement voice control with google as well. Right now, you can control this with voice only on Amazon's Alexa platform. Another thing that I wish they could implement is the ability to remotely set the time, temp and start the cook. For example I would like the ability to start a cook when I leave work and have dinner waiting for me when I get home. Right now you cannot control this device remotely even though it has wi-fi capability. Overall an excellent device to have around in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Khush N

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating purchase, When it works - its not a bad. But ... But it rarely works well. 2 issues: It will constantly turn off. Once you finally get it started - do not set the timer on the app - it will turn the device off and you will be at step one trying to get it restarted which will take quite a while. Issue 2: They require you to create an account and sign in each time you use the device. I'm not opening a financial account, why can't I just turn it on and use it? I see myself purchasing a different brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: The app is terrible
customer_reviews.text: So Sous Vide is pretty simple, you set the time and temperature. Every other circulation machine makes that simple. This one requires a pointlessly complicated app that makes doing the simple task of setting time and temp difficult. I do not need to go through their preset menu. I am returning this and getting a machine that allows for the simple task without a ridiculous app.
customer_reviews.author: Eastbay Cat

customer_reviews.title: best steaks we've ever cooked
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes amazing steaks with very little effort. The app was originally a little twitchy but has since had some updates and seems to be fine since then. Only thing I would mention is that cooking steaks is pretty much the only thing we use it for. It does other things, but we don't really use those functions. As long you make the regular steak and you're okay with that investment, I say go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Never Used the item
customer_reviews.text: This item requires an Internet connection and a cloud account with the manufacturer before you can use it. That wasn't clear in the info at the time of purchase. I returned it without setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Cope

customer_reviews.title: Expensive product, received one that looked USED with no pamphlet or manual
customer_reviews.text: SERIOUSLYS CHEFSTEPS???? For such an expensive product supposedly shipped by the manufacturer you would expect a quality product to be shipped to you. Nope. The product I received had scuff marks all over and didnt even come with a pamphlet or manual! This was supposed to be a surprise christmas gift to the hubby, THANK GOODNESS I opened the box to see what it looked like otherwise it would have been a huge disappointment to see such a sloppy (probably USED) product that I paid full price for. If I wanted a used one, I would have paid half price on ebay. Thanks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Deezy

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star, works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no problems with connectivity. Application for iPhone works perfect. I also bought the carry case for it. I've cooked chicken, pork chops, and steaks without any problems. America Test Kitchen did a great review of this model and that's why I purchased it. I'd recommend this to any of my family and friends. The phone app is a breeze to use and has pictures to show how done your protein will be. I use this more than three times a week. You can set it and forget it!! Buy it and have fun!!
customer_reviews.author: boomer503

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I wonder how many steaks I had turn out "blah" before purchasing my Joule sous vide. I LOVE THIS PRODUCT! It is a perfect size to store when not in use. It makes an average kitchen into an extraordinary one instantly. It works great. It is useful for so many other foods but our favorite is for the Delmonico rib eye steaks. Perfect food every time and the app is a great addition to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: As I really can’t find a way to contact Chefsteps maybe this will get your attention? I ordered this product and after 6 months it has stopped working. I’m happy to send it back for a replacement and to change my review back to good if someone will just get in contact with me please?
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Device broke 30 minutes into first use. Was cooking a steak very nicely when left light stated blinking red. Was never able to reconnect to app. Hope to be able to return, waiting to hear from customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: I would have given Joule Sous Vide 5 stars if it were not for three things: 1) Terrible tech support. No phone number and the response to email takes a couple of days and even them with useless information. 2) It can only work with 2.4 WiFi and not 5.0. In my case I use 5.0 since I get better overall WiFi results. 3) Does not always keep Bluetooth connection even when I leave the phone within 2 feet. Joule has to controls and only functions in consort with the App which makes connection critical. On the positive side, when it works it is great and the time and temperature numbers given in the App are accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Hamid

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with the Joule
customer_reviews.text: I have been using another brand for the past two years. I purchased the Joule on Prime day and couldn't be happier. Super easy to set up and use. Running it from the software had a very light learning curve, but no more than using Apple Remote to run my Apple TV. I have not yet used the media and recipe options, but the core functions of setting, heating and clean up are drop dead perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby O

customer_reviews.title: My favorite circulator.
customer_reviews.text: I have an Anova One and the Joule. I bought the Joule because the Anova has shorted on me a few times when steam enters the vents, which is frustrating. When you compare the two, the Joule wins, hands down. Better design, water resistant, less hassle to use, easier to store. Sure, the Anova has a display, but there's not that much value to having a display. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K. Darling

customer_reviews.title: Joule will not connect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband 7 months ago. We have had difficulty connecting to it the past 3 or 4 times we used it. Now, we cannot connect to it at all and I can't find any way to contact the company for troubleshooting or returns.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Cook

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding sous vide and recipe guidance
customer_reviews.text: The Joule has rapidly become an everyday fixture in my home, particularly during this time of quarantine. It allows for precise temperature controlled cooking and food prep, and gives detailed and friendly guidance within the app. If I were to level one criticism at the way the ecosystem is set up, it's that it becomes difficult to actually implement the many recipes on offer, since (at least for me) I normally use the Joule app after I pull out my (already vacuum sealed) meat. This is largely a workflow problem on my end however, and would be difficult to remedy without Joule also actively getting into the meal prep market - which is a whole different ball of wax.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Design, Tasty, Easy Meals
customer_reviews.text: So far I've cooked London Broil - which my husband said was the most tender he's ever had - New York Strip Steak - also very good - carrots - very fresh and tasty - a whole chicken - juicy and flavorful - savory breakfast egg cups, and pots de creme - both super tasty. I'm quite happy with the purchase. i like that the unit is small and fits easily in the cabinet. Everything has gone smoothly; the app works well, and I look forward to many more easy meals.
customer_reviews.author: IthacaNancy

customer_reviews.title: Love to sous vide
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product. I use my Joule 2-3 times a week, most often on Sundays doing meal prep for the week. Worth the investment. Started with a cheap sous vide device that lasted about a year. The Joule is much higher in quality and has excellent temperature control. I have experienced some difficulty connecting it to the internet for software updates but not enough to keep this from being 5 star. Have started giving these to others as wedding presents.
customer_reviews.author: Razz

customer_reviews.title: Salt in the Wound...
customer_reviews.text: After paying $200 for this appiance I feel like ChefSteps is really greedy with their settings. They want to charge an extra $40 for more settings/recipes on the app. Sure, you get the basics but to get the full use you have to buy the subscription and just seems excessive. The product works great but there are issues with loosing wifi conection all the time...so close but now I'm having second thoughts. They also bombard you with offers to buy their pre-made sauces and other products.
customer_reviews.author: Rick E., San Clemente CA

customer_reviews.title: My secret weapon
customer_reviews.text: This was a life changing purchase. Since learning to use the Joule, which was easy btw, I have mastered the art of juicy, perfect, moist, attractive, and tender steaks and chicken cutlets. My cooking was never more organized, effortless, and consistent. My kitchen stays cleaner and cooler as do I. Healthy attractive protein is never too many minutes away. Truly revolutionary. I am never going back to my old ways of cooking steaks and chicken cutlets. Physically this device is beautiful, elegant, works as described, and feels solid as a tank. The software, like everything else about the Joule, is helpful and well designed. Would not consider any other circulator, this was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: mithril

customer_reviews.title: Buggy Software on Android
customer_reviews.text: I have used this unit about 6 times since purchase. It works great when you can get it going. The phone app takes a long time to start. When started its not smooth sailing. On each and every attempt, I have had to toggle through multiple error messages on my phone before it would start. Once its going I leave it alone and turn it off by pulling the plug. On the WiFi: I have a Samsung Note 3. I have never been able to get the WiFi interface to work with Joule. Reboot, restart, stand close...it won't pair, period. Otherwise very happy with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wand for the App Generation
customer_reviews.text: This was my first sous vide tool and liked it immediately. Although I enjoy the tutorials of the required app like others I’m not so in love with having to use it every single time, sometimes I forget to charge my phone and kitchen outlets are scarce. I found Gourmia sous vide on clearance in a store and thought it was a great find so I could do multiple jobs with different temperatures. The Joule is NOTICEABLY smaller and QUIETER than the Gourmia so much so that I almost took the Gourmia back. Almost.
customer_reviews.author: Chalo6770

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, bugged app
customer_reviews.text: It's a great idea to make a simple cool looking pipe without any (only 1) buttons fully controlled by a phone. Unfortunately, it requires a friendly working app and this is where Joule fails miserably: it's not easy to use, it does not do what it claims, it can't reset the password, it does not have a basic password confirm, the heater/pump turns of when it feels like it or there is a WiFi interruption. Should not be hard to fix it all but it has not been done and cute recipes and jokes do not compensate for it.
customer_reviews.author: yuri

customer_reviews.title: Poor network reliability
customer_reviews.text: "Hey guys, I know connectivity issues still exists. But hey!, lets just release this product to the public even though its 5 patches behind." "Ohh you wanted to update your firmware. Let's try to connect first. Oh woops."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works great! Used it the day after receiving it
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Used it the day after receiving it. Paired with my iPhone no problem. Gave it a good workout the very first time cooking carrots, chicken, and filet mignon at two different temp at two different times. It kept the temperature exactly as set. I lost the connection a couple times but figured out I was too far away. When the phone was closer it never lost the connection. The steam was perfect, both temps. It's very quiet. The only noise is from the water coming out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Cooks meat and steals privacy
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work, but the app is slow. Takes a long time to recognize choices, app seems to be written entirely for marketing purposes. Did not stop cooking after the timer was up. Just kept on going. Dissapointed with the overall experience. Deleted the app (requires to know my location at all times, creepy?) and thinking about a more reliable unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kaliper Konheim

customer_reviews.title: My Joule is my new go-to device in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, but this little tool is unbelievable. We now invest in the whole tenderloin at Costco, and I cut them into 2" steaks and freeze them. So worth it! Steaks come out absolutely perfectly done, edge to edge, and after a quick sear they are as good as or better than the filet you get at the best restaurants. You can even cook them frozen (just takes a little more time) and they turn out just as good as fresh. I've also made chicken, pork tenderloin, and eggs--all perfectly done. It is seamlessly controlled by both my iPhone and iPad. My Joule is my new go-to device in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Linda in CA

customer_reviews.title: Best Steak Ever
customer_reviews.text: If you have never tried Sous Vide cooking then you are just missing out. A friend of mine recommended the Joule and I decided to give it a try. All I can say is WOW! My steaks have never been cooked better or been more tender. A little practice goes a long way but if you are looking for an easy way to make a whole lot of different foods then give this a shot. I also like the fact that I don't need to waste space on my cook top or BBQ to get great tasting foods.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive with no additional accessories
customer_reviews.text: I knew going in that this was not a manual product and I have had no problem with using it over WiFi. It was actually very easy to set up and use. I still wish it had the option for manual operation. The one thing I absolutely hate is that, for the price of this product it didn’t come with the big clamp. There’s no reason to sell that clamp for an additional $25 when the Joule is already going for $200.
customer_reviews.author: SwayKilljoy

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest gadget I've ever added to my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest gadget I've added to my kitchen since I've had a kitchen. It makes cooking anything to perfection the easiest thing in the world! It amazes me how much food gets infused with the flavors of whatever aromatics you enclose with it for the cooking process. I particularly like it for steaks, rack of lamb and duck- those expensive cuts you really don't want to mess up by overcooking. With Joule, overcooking is nearly impossible! The app makes it very easy to use and the suggested recipes and cooking techniques are great!
customer_reviews.author: mike leathers

customer_reviews.title: Don't
customer_reviews.text: First, you have to go to the App store and PAY FOR AN APP to get this thing to work. Good luck getting it set up. Between the password, linking, and overall connectivity crapola you need a degree from MIT to make it work. I returned mine....
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Best form factor out there.
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and look. Could find a better way to connect to phone though, kind of finicky with the Bluetooth and WiFi. May be in the next generation have a simple on board functionality. There is always room for improvement and convenience. Other than that, steaks turn out awesome, the app is easy to use when looking for something to cook. I Really like this product and would recommend it to those looking for an immersion cooker Can't wait to see whats next from chefsteps.
customer_reviews.author: FrazrKing

customer_reviews.title: Great Sous Vide with an occasional design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and highly accurate Sous Vide pump. I cook steaks perfectly medium rare, chicken that is still juicy without overcooking, and even whole roasts with ease. The only reason I give this 4 stars rather than 5 is the App only controls. You have to use an app to set the unit (temp and time). The app works great generally, but occasionally has connection issues, which is a real pain given there are no on unit controls to use as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Hans

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: The Joule is simple enough for someone who has had no sous vide experience to be able to use! The wifi capabilities make it so I can monitor and control the device from anywhere! The app gets 4/5 for user friendliness. The recipes have strange measurements, for example instead of a 1/2 gallon of milk for yogurt it told me I needed approximately 1lb 4oz. Not the most proficient at weighing liquids, but the temps and timers are on point! P.S. the picture is my setup, a 12qt Cambro with lid that I just cut a hole in. Works Perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: richard bowen

customer_reviews.title: Really compact and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: This sous vide is very easy to store since it has a small form factor. I like that it was really easy to set up. However you need to make an account with them in order to connect to the sous vide. Also it doesn't have an interface on the unit it self so you need to download the app to set the temperature and time. Compared to the anova its a lot smaller but it doesn't move as much water.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: From D cook to B+
customer_reviews.text: We had a learning curve with certain meats, but this thing is awesome. My chicken and pork game has increased significantly, always perfectly cooked. Sometimes the recomended cook times aren't long enough to get the tenderness out of steak and pork, so we usually leave it in for 30mins more and it takes care of the issue. Everything mechanically and electronically about the Vide is awesome. The bluetooth works great, I never have annoying pairing issues. I highly reccomend a bag sealer with this. We ordered one when we bought the Vide and it works great to seal your food and just drop it in.
customer_reviews.author: Tactical Bandit

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sous vide cooker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sous vide cooker. Others have mentioned you have to use the phone app, but there app is seamlessly integrated into the cooking experience. The app it self is easy to use and incorporates a huge cookbook for the sous vide cook to experiment with. It heats quickly and the magnetic bottom makes using steel pots easy. I highly recommend getting the larger side holder. It makes connecting easy and more secure than the standard side holder.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Starbuck

customer_reviews.title: Makes Great Steaks
customer_reviews.text: After much research this is the sous vide my wife chose for Mother's Day. She loves it! Temperature is stable. The online recipes and control from the app are very convenient. Connectivity is never a problem. So far every meal has been spot on (steak, fish, chicken, eggs benedict, etc) It stores easily in a drawer and the slimmer design of this model leave more room in the pot for food.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: worked for a bit...
customer_reviews.text: ive had it for a year and still hasnt broken.... does the job well. great app. *update* within the first year i noticed it began making an odd sound and heating the water slower.... did some research and did the "cleaning cycles" nothing changed, but it still worked so no biggie. now year 2 it has completely failed. for the cost and the way i took care of it (this sous vide is something i really cared about) im a little disappointed in it failing so quickly. Ive contact customer support and will update with their response.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely epic
customer_reviews.text: Made burgers in it, boom, dead on. Did lamb chops for dinner that night... 1 hour later... boom, epic. I absolutley love it. Cooks literally perfectly. Will experiment more tomorrow. Chicken breasts next. It's solid , super easy to use and I am just using ziplock bags for the food. It's the Chuck Norris of kitchen items.
customer_reviews.author: Steev

customer_reviews.title: Sous Vide Everything!
customer_reviews.text: This is the smallest and most powerful sous vide unit for it's size. I've heard some people complaining that it is loud for a sous vide, but in reality it's not any louder then your phone vibrating at max settings. While it can not be used without a phone, the app that is made for this Sous Vide work very well, and it is very well layed out. The app will help you make anything you need, as well as give you tips and pointers to make sure you do things right.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni S.

customer_reviews.title: Culinary Results
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 3 meals with this product so far. I am totally unimpressed with the end result. Followed the recipe from Sous Vide to the letter, used their favorite choices. Food was mediocre at best. Consider this product a huge waste of money and time, as it takes a considerable length of time to both heat the water and then cook the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for an experienced Sous Vide user
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Sous VIde (Anova Precision Cooker) for two years. After my Anova failed, I bought this unit to replace it. Initially I expected the experience to be similar to the Anova (how different can a water heater be, really), but boy was I surprised. The app is excellent, the Joule is slimmer than others and I really like the way it sticks to a metal bottom. Overall a really great purchase. Pros * Slim design (less storage required and more space for your food) * Magnet bottom * Excellent app (Visual Doneness is amazing) Cons * Have to have your cell phone with you to start the unit
customer_reviews.author: Toronto Mark

customer_reviews.title: If you do not own one or two of these ... what are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.text: Small enough to fit in a common kitchen drawer, while being powerful enough to do all the sous vide cooking your heart desires. If you haven't cooked sous vide...you are truly missing out. Salmon, steaks, chicken, burgers, vegetables... you have all the precise control you need to cook amazing meals. I love cooking salmon and steaks with the Joule... perfect every time! Head over to the Chef Steps website and try some of their amazing recipes. the beef short ribs recipe is a winner all day long. In 24 hours you have an amazing meal... pair it with the cauliflower puree and wow! Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank R Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: well designed, and great app!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my life partner, he loves it! He has made me steak and chicken so far and both were amazing! So easy to use and the app really has great content and short videos and recipes which make cooking with it a breeze. We used ziplock bags for our foods and set it on the stove in a big metal pasta pot and it makes super yummy food... Very happy with this product and the software.
customer_reviews.author: Worthit

customer_reviews.title: The app does not work well
customer_reviews.text: When the app works this device is awesome. Problem for me is it takes about 10 attempts over 30 mins to get it started. Really sucks. Try other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R Rostkowski

customer_reviews.title: Best sous vide out there
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a sous vide, this is definitely the one I’d choose. We’ve made chicken, pork chops, steak, and short ribs and all were just amazing. This heats up quickly and the app is super simple to use. There aren’t a ton of recipes so I do wonder what I’d do if I found a recipe online that wasn’t in the app but this has been a great addition to our household.
customer_reviews.author: Kf2222

customer_reviews.title: ... Anova mostly because of its size and I could easily store in a kitchen drawer
customer_reviews.text: I chose this over the Anova mostly because of its size and I could easily store in a kitchen drawer. The high wattage really helps with getting water up to temp quickly compared with the 800W Anova. Has become a regular use item in my kitchen. The app does need work but doesn't impact the functionality of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Big E

customer_reviews.title: A whole new world of cooking possibilities.
customer_reviews.text: I am a total beginner to Sous Vide but the ChefSteps Joule made getting started super easy and the results are amazing. The phone app may be intimidating for some but for me it just makes the whole usage experience better. Easy temperature customization and remote monitoring of cooking is how modern cooking should work. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DaDane

customer_reviews.title: Works great but really awful app and connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and heats up fast. The app and connectivity is awful. I write software for a living and the Joule app is one of the most confusing and quirky apps I've ever come across. It doesn't stay connected and reconnecting can be frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Stan V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: So far I have made only a handful of items from Joule App's vast menu, but every single item came out perfect. Even a lowly hard boiled egg was the best I ever had (and I tried to find a perfect method for making hard boiled eggs for years). Chicken is the juiciest ever, steak is perfect. With meats, I still need to work on my 'browning skills'. For a price of a few dinners out, Joule is a welcome addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: ALY

customer_reviews.title: Wait worth it
customer_reviews.text: I follow ChefSteps almost like from the early days of the page and when they revealed the Joule I knew that I would have one. Waited almost 2 years to have the chance to buy it and totally worth it. Easy to use, friendly and intuitive app, and if you are a true ChefSyep fan you know where to find ideas, furthermore if you know the basics and are real curious will have a blast palying with it like i do.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Joule after reading about the anova having reliability issues. Brand new Joule out of the box is dead and won’t turn on. Will be returning and exchanging for an anova and save a few dollars too! Disappointed as I was excited to play with a new cooking device and had bought all the ingredients necessary.
customer_reviews.author: WSUSHOX22

customer_reviews.title: Get it. Cuts time for meal prep
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas, and it is so easy to use! I hate cooking meat because I always tend to either over cook it or burn it. I do all the weekly lunch meal prepping in our house and since using this our chicken comes out perfect everytime. My husband has cooked all kinds of meats in it and they’ve been awesome. Fish has been the only meat that didn’t fair too well... it’s just so soft to begin with that it just makes it mushy.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good things
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this thing. It is so versatile and we love to fire it up for fancier dinner parties. Very versatile - we've made almost ever meat and cooking style you can imagine. Flavor, juiciness and tenderness... I just can't replicate it with any other form of cooking. And I love to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: The real deal!!!
customer_reviews.text: We spent almost a year with another brand sous vide unit that had nothing but problems, and wouldn't stay connected via bluetooth or wifi. Then we bought a Joule, out of the box, setup within minutes, temp. stayed within .2 degree during a 6 hour cook. We made prime rib on our first cook and it came out perfect. The phone app worked easy peasy. It's half the size of brand X, but it's considerably faster heating up the water. Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: STN609

customer_reviews.title: Not as  impressed as I thought I would be
customer_reviews.text: You have to have a wifi connection and mine wouldn't stay connected so it was a pain trying to reconnect it. I put it back in the box and haven't used it since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: App images to match doneness-Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, and the Bluetooth connection to the detailed real life images showing the level of doneness on the app are so helpful and easy to follow. This is a whole new and easy way of cooking without drying out the food in the oven or on a grill.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: This product is brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: Stunningly accurate. I sous vide all the time and the proteins are so much more superior than my old methods. A blistering hot cast or carbon steel pan for 45 seconds a side and you would not know you did not cook it in a pan (except that the inner temp and color goes edge to edge) Fantastic product. We make our own sous vide boneless turkey breast and no longer get turkey from the deli. it is melt in your mouth tender.and costs half as much.
customer_reviews.author: NikonLee

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy For A Non "Grill Master"
customer_reviews.text: I am having so much fun with this thing. It cooks all my food to perfection, I actually look like I know what I am doing now. I love how it is app based, and the app is great and offers great recipes. I didn't realize how many things this thing can actually cook. I will say if you are really good around a grill and you are looking to use this for only steak, chicken and pork this is probably not something you need. The only thing this would offer over a grill for a "grill master" is the freedom to not have to tend to the meat while it is cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Not my BFF
customer_reviews.text: It runs on only the weak 2G WiFi and for that I needed to move it to my living room where the WiFi extender lives. That’s not where I want to cook with a large container of warm water. If I use the Bluetooth connection, my phone and I have to babysit it. And no, it’s not my BFF.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best thing I've bought this year!!!
customer_reviews.text: I went from being a food noob, to making jaw-dropping amazing steaks and chicken in a month. You don't need a vacuum sealer. A ziplock bag, a modest receptacle and the Joule to be well on your way to making really good, high end steak house type foods. Set your time and temp thru the app and that's it. Sear afterwards with one of the many ways (I use cast iron) and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Tony R.

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Sous vide changed the cooking game for me, and this is a good one. Some people may be bothered that this product is controlled almost completely by a mobile app; I actually enjoy the feature. The cook times on bigger and/or tougher cuts of meat can be long, and the mobile control allows you to do things like change cook temperature from work (or using an Alexa device). The app and related website also provide a bunch of recipes that take some of the mystery out of using a new cooking technique. And the food has come out awesome so far. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: EnterTheDave

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Can’t connect to the Wi-Fi or Bluetooth reset application reset jewel still won’t work
customer_reviews.author: randy buckner

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned cheaper sous vide cookers, and the Joule is the best. It’s powerful (heats quickly), and super easy to use with the app. I’ve cooked fish, steak, chicken and even hamburgers. Everything comes out great! Only 1 minor criticism, notifications don’t always work. Buy it, you won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Cycle Fudge

customer_reviews.title: Careful: Scalding water splashes everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Wish they had better variety of recipe or more helpful temp & cook time settings guide for novices. Water splashes pretty far during operation, leaving hard water spots everywhere. May be inherent with all sous vide machines. Takes hours too cook anything, even soft boiled eggs. Kinda gave up after ‘brand new & shiny’ novelty wore off. Otherwise a real solidly made and one of the most accurate, reliable sous vide machines.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Newbie or veteran and serious about sous vide cooking?
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, great results . App makes it pretty easy to use. Heats up really fast and can use with any magnetic pot via the magnetic bottom or plastic container via the clamp . I’ve brought it with me on trips to introduce family and friends to sous vide cooking . Concerned about the lack of other options for controlling the device - one iOS update away from having a some trouble . I have an old iPhone that I keep around just in case . You can control the device with an Alexa . That’s also pretty cool. All and all, it’s pretty awesome - 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Michael G. Holder

customer_reviews.title: Great device and super convenient
customer_reviews.text: Incredible little device. I own other models such as Sansaire and Anova One, and in love with this device. Even though you control with an app, it's incredibly powerful for its size and nothing is better than putting it in the drawer after use. Easy to stow for travel and it looks great. What more do you need?
customer_reviews.author: W. E. Beck

customer_reviews.title: My life has changed because of it
customer_reviews.text: My life has changed because of this WONDERFUL tool. I cook every day for my kids, without it, I don't think I can do it. I really thank my friends who introduced me to Sous Vide. I think every sane person should at least give it a try and don't pass it up as some fancy gadget; it is NOT. It's a major milestone of kitchen appliance. This is absolutely a MUST BUY!!!!! MUST BUY!!!!! Again, MUST BUY!!!!!.
customer_reviews.author: J. Koskinen

customer_reviews.title: Good cooking
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second hand which said it is in a very good condition. A little disappointed on the condition since the device is a little bit dirty. However, functional wise is good. We cooked lamb and it tasted so good. The only thing is that it always needs to control by cell phone. Make sure you have your phone always with you.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: 3 uses in 6 month period and it has completely died!
customer_reviews.text: So after only 3 uses of this machine in a 6 month period of owning it, it will no longer power on at all. This is unacceptable for something this expensive to be of this poor quality! I've contacted Chef Steps for a warranty claim and currently waiting for a response. I will be updating this review depending on how this situation is handled by the company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless without the app
customer_reviews.text: As long as the app is working you’re ok (although controlling it manually is confusing) but if the app crashes and won’t open - even if you re-download it you’re screwed and the product is a worthless door stop. Kinda like I’m dealing with now.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wonder

customer_reviews.title: Never connects, you've been warned.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible app one of the worst. You will never and I mean never be able to connect to the Wi-Fi. Around 28% of the time you'll actually be able to connect to the Bluetooth. You'll spend an hour and a half trying to get the thing to connect before it even heats any water. You certainly won't be able to walk away let alone cook anything that's more than 5 ft away out of Bluetooth range, if you actually ever get connected. I holistically regret buying a chef steps sous vide.
customer_reviews.author: jy

customer_reviews.title: Way more useful than I even thought possible.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly thought the Joule was going to be a sort of niche, once-in-a-while kitchen tool, but I've been using this several times a week, and absolutely loving it. I'm a decent cook, but I've always had an amount of anxiety with regard to over- or under-cooking things like steak, pork, chicken, and salmon. Not anymore! The app that Joule offers is incredibly user-friendly, and as a company, they're really responsive to feedback. 10/10 would buy a Joule again.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Great Gadget for your resident Cooking Guru
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my father in law - a man that is a mad scientist in the kitchen! He loves gadgets, and this it the ultimate for any home cook who craves perfect meat temperatures - the results really are amazing. I never had a steak / pork chop like I had when prepared with the Sous Vide!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica RiRi

customer_reviews.title: Just buy this
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few months now and LOVE it! I feel like I'm "cheating" the system when using this - our steaks turn out PERFECT every single time.. we love doing filets via sous vide now. I use it with an iPad we have in the kitchen and the app/interface is very easy to use and just works. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Two days until Limited warranty and it takes a dump
customer_reviews.text: This device was a staple in my kitchen for the last 363 days and today while prepping some chicken it errors out stating failure to circulate water. Not sure I can stand behind a product that is a premium cost and can't withstand the riggers of a functioning kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly cooked food, every time
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from the Anova Precision Cooker because the wifi on the Anova is atrocious. This thing has never done me wrong, only downside is the lack of external controls. Perfectly cooked food every time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lippert

customer_reviews.title: The size is nice and small (compared to our last one) and the ...
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly. Exact temperature control is phenomenal. The size is nice and small (compared to our last one) and the intake/output is at the bottom so we need significantly less water to cook. The app works well and I do not find it to be less convenient than a button or knob on the device.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lampke

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first use
customer_reviews.text: This product failed halfway through first time using. This is after I spent hour or so trying to get it to connect to WiFi and Bluetooth. Overly complicated with no controls on the actual device.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Keyer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I spent a considerable amount of time looking at various models before buying this one. My first experience and I think it’s an excellent product. Time will tell how reliable it is but I prepared two 14 oz steaks in just about an hour. Another few minutes searing in my trusty cast iron skillet and they were fabulous. A friend who has a different brand insisted I should allow two hours but I think her model is older and less power.
customer_reviews.author: mary jo byrnes

customer_reviews.title: Best Sous Vide for Home
customer_reviews.text: Not bulky and very easy to use. The Joule app is a breeze to use. Everything we've sous vide has turned out great especially steaks. This is one must-have kitchen tool that everyone needs to get.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: We love the Joule!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for husband in October for his birthday. He uses it on average 2 times per week. The meat is so tender and perfectly cooked. He has cooked steaks, venison roasts, kielbasa, Italian sausage, pork chops, our Thanksgiving turkey and more. The Bluetooth has disconnected on its own one time during use, but we were not home and when we arrived back home we noticed that we had lost electricity briefly because of a small storm we were experiencing. Overall we are very pleased with the joule and promote it to everyone we talk to.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: If the App Doesn't Work, Neither Does This Device
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in January 2019 from Amazon. I have to admit, I was warned about the fatal flaw - in order to utilize Joule you MUST do so through the mobile App. Well, in the last couple of weeks, they updated the App, and now I have a $200+ brick. Based upon this, I strongly suggest looking at other sous vide devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have in your kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! Cooks food perfectly. Is easy to use, no big clean up. Have used it to make large meals for friends and family, they insisted that I had a professional chef make the meal! I am obsessed and highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Arena T

customer_reviews.title: Try Sous Vide with Joule!
customer_reviews.text: Been considering learning to cook with this method and after researching I chose the Joule. I am happy that I did it has been a piece of cake to Sous Vide with it. I would definitely buy another and recommend this product to whomever is considering learning to cook with this technique!
customer_reviews.author: T Squared

product_meta.title: Breville Joule Sous Vide, 1100 Watts, White Body, Stainless Steel Cap & Base
product_meta.description: Joule is the smallest, most powerful sous vide tool available. It heats water faster than any other immersion circulator or precision cooker and holds the temperature with absolute accuracy to ensure perfect results every time. Controlled exclusively by a groundbreaking app that empowers sous vide veterans and novices alike, Joule gives you the freedom to cook from anywhere. Maximum water temperature - 208 degree fahrenheit. Maximum bath volume - 10+ gallons (40+ liters).
feature_bullets: Smallest, sleekest sous vide tool available at just 11 inches tall and 1.3 pounds, with streamlined white body and solid stainless steel cap & base.
Saves space: Half the size of other sous vide machines, it's small enough to slip into a top drawer. IEEE 802.11 b/g/n Wi-Fi compatible 2.4 Ghz only
Heats up fast: 1100 watts of power for hyper-fast water heating. System requirements: iOS 8.0 or later, Android 4.4 or later, internet access required for some features

Perfect results: Visual Doneness feature in the Joule app displays exactly how food cooks. Dinner comes out predictably perfect, every time. Vessel requirements - Minimum water depth - 1.5 inch (38 millimeter). Maximum water depth - 8 inch (203 millimeter)
Wifi and bluetooth ready: Works with iPhone or Android? connect with Bluetooth alone, or cook from anywhere with WiFi. Bluetooth smart 4.0 wireless technology
Voltage warning: Works with 120 V outlets only. Due to our precise heating technology, voltage transformers and converters can damage your Joule, and use outside of North America voids the Warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,812 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
